org.intermine.web.logic

Class SortableMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<K,V>
        • java.util.LinkedHashMap
          • org.intermine.web.logic.SortableMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map

    public class SortableMap
extends java.util.LinkedHashMap
    SortableMap extends a LinkedHashMap with some useful sorting features. By default it behaves identical to a LinkedHashMap. When you want to sort keys or values, then invoke the sorting as follows: sortableMap.sortKeys(); or sortableMap.sortValues(); By default the objects are sorted ascending on their natural order. For strings that is "111", "22", "3". If you want to check numeric strings and force them to be sorted on numeric order "3", "22", "111", then invoke the sorting as follows: sortableMap.sortKeys(true, true); or sortableMap.sortValues(true, true); The boolean 2nd parameter indicates the sort order. If true, then the map will be sorted ascending. If false, then the map will be sorted descending. The following example will sort the objects descending on natural order. sortableMap.sortKeys(false, false); or sortableMap.sortValues(false, false);
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
